net.alomax.timedom.fp6

Class FilterPicker6

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.alomax.timedom.TimeDomainProcess
      • net.alomax.timedom.BasicPicker
        • net.alomax.timedom.fp6.FilterPicker6
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    USGSFP6Extension

    public class FilterPicker6
extends BasicPicker
    The FP6 algorithm processes a set of bands with center periods Tn and bandwidth Wb given by the ratio Tn/Tn-1. For each filter band the data samples are processed through a Butterworth bandpass filter, and picking statistics and a characteristic function (CF) are generated. Picks are triggered and declared based on analysis of the maximum of the CF values over all filter bands. This analysis involves the level and integrals of the maximum CF within tUp and tUpMin, and uses the threshold values threshold1 and thresh2.

    For details on the FP6 algorithm see net/alomax/timedom/fp6/doc/FilterPicker6_algorithm.pdf and net/alomax/timedom/fp6/*.java source files.

    Declared picks are stored in an ArrayList of FilterPicker6PickData objects, public ArrayList FilterPicker6.getPickData() should be called after each call to FilterPicker6.apply() to recover new picks.

    FilterPicker6 uses an automatically created memory object FilterPicker6_Memory to allow support re-entry to picker for contiguous data samples from the same channel. Consequently, an instance of FilterPicker6 can only be used for contiguous data from a single channel. If there is a gap in the data, FilterPicker6.initializeMemory() should be invoked before the next call to FilterPicker6.apply()

    Pseudocode example of how FilterPicker6 can be used: 

     // Create a FilterPicker6 object:
 // initialize: String localeText, double longTermWindowFactor,
 //     double threshold1, double thresh2,
 //     double tUp, double tUpMin
 ...
 // EITHER:
 // construct a FilterPicker6 object  with a filtWindow ...
 // initialize: double filtWindow
 ...
 FilterPicker6 filterPicker6 = new FilterPicker6(locale, longTermWindowFactor, threshold1, thresh2, tUp, tUpMin, filtWindow);
 // OR:
 // construct a FilterPicker6 object  with a filtWindow
 // initialize: FilterPicker6_BandParameters[] bandParameters
 ...
 FilterPicker6 filterPicker6 = new FilterPicker6(locale, bandParameters, longTermWindowFactor, threshold1, thresh2, tUp, tUpMin, filtWindow);

 // check settings:
 try {
 filterPicker6.checkSettings();
 } catch (TimeDomainException fe) {
 throw (fe);
 }

 // apply picker to one or more trace segments:
 // set double dt
 ...
 // loop over contiguous data trace segments
 float[] sample;
 while ((sample = nextSample() != null) {
 // apply
 try {
 float[] modified_sample = filterPicker6.apply(dt, sample);
 } catch (TimeDomainException tde) {
 ...
 }
 // On the first call of apply(), a FilterPicker6_Memory object will be initialized and updated,
 //     on subsequent calls, the FilterPicker6_Memory object will be used and updated.
 // handle picks:
 ArrayList\ picks = (ArrayList\) filterPicker6.getPickData();
          ...
          // clear pick array
          filterPicker6.clearTriggerPickData();
      }

    For examples of how FilterPicker6 can be used through calls to its get and set methods and in an interactive environment, see net.alomax.seisgram2k.toolmanager.FilterPicker6ToolManager.java.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • bandParameters

        protected FilterPicker6_BandParameters[] bandParameters
        Array of nBand filter band parameters (band periods and thresholdScaleFactor), set explicitly in the constructor or through the setBandParams() method. Note that the ratio of each band period band to previous shorter band period must be approximately constant, see bwFactor.

      • filterWindow

        protected double filterWindow
        // _DOC_ Filter window (filtWindow) in seconds sets the approximate longest filter band period when the bands are not explicitly set. The filter window will be adjusted upwards to be an integer N power of 2 times the sample interval (deltaTime). Then nBand = N + 1 "filter bands" are created, starting with start from bwFactor * Nyquist period (2*deltaTime).

      • longTermWindowFactor

        protected double longTermWindowFactor
        // _DOC_ The long term window factor (longTermWindowFactor) determines the decay constant of a simple recursive filter to accumulate/smooth all picking statistics and characteristic functions for all filter bands.

      • threshold1

        protected double threshold1
        // _DOC_ threshold1 sets the threshold to trigger a pick event (potential pick). This threshold is reached when the (clipped) characteristic function for any filter band nBand exceeds threshold1 * thresholdScaleFactor[nBand]. threshold1 is also used to confirm a pick, see tUpMin.

      • threshold2

        protected double threshold2
        // _DOC_ thresh2 sets the threshold to declare a pick event (pick will be accepted when tUp reached). This threshold is reached when the integral of the maximum (clipped) characteristic function over all filter bands within the window tUp exceeds thresh2 * tUp (i.e. the average (clipped) characteristic function over window tUp is greater than thresh2).

      • tUpEvent

        protected double tUpEvent
        // _DOC_ tUp sets the maximum time window after threshold1 is reached (pick event triggered) in which the integral of the (clipped) characteristic function is accumulated to declare a pick. A pick is declared if this integral exceeds thresh2 * tUp.

      • tUpEventMin

        protected double tUpEventMin
        // _DOC_ tUpMin sets a minimum time window after threshold1 is reached (pick event triggered) in which an integral of the (clipped) characteristic function is accumulated to confirm a pick. A pick is confirmed if this integral exceeds threshold1 * tUpMin.

      • bandWidthFactor

        protected double bandWidthFactor
        Band width factor use for initializing band pass filter. Bandwidth is measured at an amplitude of 0.707 of filter peak; must be approximately ratio of each band period band to previous shorter band period. bwFactor is set automatically if band parameters are initialized explicitly.

      • numPolesBandPass

        protected int numPolesBandPass
        number of poles for band-pass filter

      • numBands

        protected int numBands
        number of filter bands

      • fp6Memory

        protected FilterPicker6.FilterPicker6_Memory fp6Memory
        memory structure to hold results of last pick pass on sequential data from same channel

      • deltaTime

        protected double deltaTime
        sampling interval of data, not known until first call of method apply()

      • BANDWIDTH_THRES_ERROR

        protected static double BANDWIDTH_THRES_ERROR

      • BANDWIDTH_THRES_WARNING

        protected static double BANDWIDTH_THRES_WARNING

        public static final boolean DEBUG

      • saveBandCharFunc

        protected boolean saveBandCharFunc
        Flag to enable/disable storing of clipped characteristic function values for each band for all samples passed to apply().

      • bandCharFunc

        protected float[][] bandCharFunc
        Array to store clipped characteristic function values for each band for all samples passed to apply(). Values are only stored if setSaveBandCharFunc(true) is called after FilterPicker6 construction. Values can be retrieved by calling public float[][] getBandCharFunc() after each call to apply().

        bandParameters - bands to use
        longTermWindowFactor - long term window factor

        Parameters:
        str - approximate longest filter band period (floating point string)
        Throws:
        TimeDomainException

      • initializeBandsAuto

        protected void initializeBandsAuto(double filterWindow)
                            throws TimeDomainException
        Initialize filter bands automatically. Bands will be spaced by bwFactor from bwFactor * deltaTime * 2.0 to first period greater than specified filtWindow; thresholdScaleFactor is set to 1.0 gives backwards compatibility with FilterPicker5
        Parameters:
        filterWindow -
        Throws:
        TimeDomainException

        protected int calculatePhaseShiftInSamples(double period)
        Calculated a phase shift corresponding to the applied bandpass filter at the specified period
        Parameters:
        period -
        Returns:
        phase shift
